userreviews.userReview: That was probably just one of my favorite short stories ever....Andy Weir..I'd read your grocery list. You can do the swag walk. PS. If you want to read this little shortie. First, don't spoil it. Second, it's right here.

Andy Weir really does like shocking his readers. You’ll hate Annie, because that’s what the author wants you to do. If you go in knowing zero detail about this short, short story, you’re going to call her dozens of names before you get to the revelation.I wish I could describe this as ‘‘original’’ but it’s sadly unrealistic. It reads weirdly and, to me, it felt like the author really had no idea how to end it so he just picked something at random to conclude it. You know the ‘‘It was all a dream…’’ ending that high school teachers forbid students to use in their writings? It’s as underwhelming as that.The Egg is a hundred times better.But if you’re interested, here’s the link to read it.

This is Andy Weir's short story that he has posted on his web site. Normally I would feel guilty including a "book" this short on my list. Yet, today was one of those days where I didn't even have five minutes to sit and read. A few friends recommended it so I thought why not. This short story can be read in five minutes. The beginning paragraphs had my mind thinking not so good things. The ending two sentences have a twist that made me laugh. This short piece of writing demonstrates that Weir is a good writer, so I will have to add more of his books to my list.
Andy Weir could totally pull the above gif off. LMAO!It's Ate Shelby's review I saw first so just click her review to read the hilarious story.

I am not usually a big fan of short stories. I also haven't read anything else by Andy Weir (that is going to change!).My mouth dropped open a few times in shock. I truly made me laugh out loud....it's great!!I'm not going to say anything else about this fabulous story because ya'll should really just READ IT! So awesome!!!
[i mean, why on EARTH would the neighbor's wife be upset by what occurred between her husband and annie? (hide spoiler)]

Find all of my reviews at: http://52bookminimum.blogspot.com/When I first saw this pop up on my feed yesterday I was all . . . . 
Let’s face facts - I haven’t had much success with Andy Weir shorties in the past. But then I logged on this morning and errrrrrryone was reading the damn thing and I’m nothing but a lemming so I jumped off the cliff with my friends because . . . 
So what did I think? To quote the extensive vocabulary of one Donald Drumpf, I thought it was “amazing” and “pretty great.” This is obviously the exception that proves the rule, I guess, when it comes to me hating Weir’s little tidbits of writing. So much cringe-worthy fun wrapped up in such a small little package. Oh, and to you Annie??????
Yep. I just slut shamed a fictional character. Annie was a smelly pirate hooker and she deserves it. Don’t like it?????
Read the story and find out for yourself:http://www.galactanet.com/oneoff/anni...
I had no idea what to expect from this short story, but it had a surprisingly funny end to it.This review and more can be found on my blog.

It's short, it's free, it's written by the guy who did The Martian, and it provides a good chuckle. What's not to like?http://www.galactanet.com/oneoff/anni...

userreviews.userReview: Who wrote this piece of crap? A 10-year-old?This is supposed to be funny? HA. HA. HA. I'm laughing my ass off right now.
Absolutely brilliant!

Oh boy, I LOVED IT!This was so lovely and so funny. The author totally amazed me. The ending left me with my mouth hanging open; I was so stunned, seriously. As soon as I finished this short story, I started re-reading it again, and this time, I couldn't help but laugh out loud. So hilarious! Damn, I love Andy Weir!You have to read it and you'll love this BAD GIRL for sure!It's free. Click here to read.

I don't know why exactly everyone is reading this sweet little story today, more than four years after its initial publication, but after already being so late to "The Martian" (which I didn't even like), it seemed only fair to read this one now among with everyone else. It will take you three minutes to read and one of the twists is absolutely hilarious, so you won't regret anything if you read it. You can do so here.
Geeze Louise. This was short and packed a punch. My humour and disdain were both building with equal pleasure. Short stories are great, prime example right here!
Sometimes I just have no sense of humor*, you know? Definitely not what I wanted to read in the morning. Gross. * that thing that hides under my grumpy face. Not today, though.

[ he has Annie making some deliberately misleading -- and totally unrealistic -- statements, with "wandering hands" and her writhing naked body and other sexual innuendos. Even if a cat could think complex thoughts, those aren't the type of thoughts it would have (hide spoiler)]

LOL!What a cute HILARIOUS little story! Wow.....that ending! I laughed till I almost cried. =)My favorite part was when she hid the can opener part under the refrigerator. Read this gem here.Enjoy it! Would I recommend this book? Yes, I would!Would I read this author again? Yes, I would and I have:The MartianPrequel to The MartianMidtown ButcherAntihypoxiantMeeting SarahAccessThe Real DealThe ChefThe Egg

This is a story about a real whore. She just wants to sleep around and not be accountable to anyone for her actions. You really need to read it, and it's free if you just click the link. Don't spoil!!
What on earth? Quick and clever, you can read it in the twinkling of an eye. I freely admit I never saw it coming. Still smiling.

description: I didn't want to wake up at 6am, especially on a Saturday. But the man I was cuddled up to was... a morning person.
title: Annie's Day
